Dear Ms. Canales:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(b) The services provided to residents and parents directly by
the institution and the services provided by outside resources.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth is supposed to receive two therapy sessions a week
however has not received any sessions in weeks.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 11/26/2024.
Complainant did not have any additional information.
Foster Care Worker was interviewed via telephone on
11/26/2024. Foster Care Worker reported Youth A has been
receiving weekly individual sessions and weekly group sessions
with Therapist. Foster Care Worker reported she spoke with
Therapist today and Therapist has been meeting with Youth A.
Chief Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 12/2/2024. Chief Administrator reported Youth A
receives therapy services at the facility from Therapist. Chief
Administrator reported Youth A has refused to participate in
therapy at times however Therapist attempts sessions with Youth
A and documents when she refuses.
Administrative Assistant was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 12/2/2024. Administrative Assistant reported Therapist
has gone above and beyond to try to provide therapy services and
build rapport with Youth A as Youth A is resistant to therapy.
Therapist was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/2/2024. Therapist reported she offers Youth A therapy
including one individual session and one group session every
week. Youth A has refused therapy sessions at times. Therapist
reported Youth A is resistant to therapy. Therapist reported Youth
A was ordered by the court at her last court hearing to participate
in therapy services as Youth A is resistant and refuses. Therapist
reported in the last two to three weeks Youth A has been
2

engaging more with therapy. Therapist reported she is flexible in
meeting with Youth A in order to work around Youth A’s schedule
to make all attempts to get Youth A to engage in sessions.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/2/2024. Youth A reported she receives individual therapy
session and group therapy at the facility. Youth A reported last
week she had one individual session and one group session.
Youth A reported she does not always receive two sessions per
week as there are times the Therapist is out of the office sick or on
vacation. Youth A reported she attends her therapy sessions.
Documents Reviewed:
• New Hope Youth Center Program Statement: New Hope
will provide (at a minimum) weekly direct therapy services
for each student to include individual and group. Individual,
group and family therapy must be provided in accordance
with the student’s treatment needs as identified in the
Individual Service Plan.
• Youth A’s Updated Service plan dated 11/17/2024: Youth A
has goals addressing behavior management and
behavioral health indicating Youth A will receive individual
and group therapy services one time a week to address
these goals.
• Youth A Therapy progress notes for September, October,
and November 2024 show Youth A has had two therapy
sessions a week including one individual and one group
session. Per progress notes at times Youth A is engaged in
session per the clinical impression and other times Youth A
is resistant. In the three-month period Youth A missed a
total of four sessions due to having other appointments,
refusing, or once due to meeting with law enforcement
during a group session.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as per interviews and review of
Youth A’s case file, Youth A is receiving therapy twice a week.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(e) Dispensing medication.
3

Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth was able to obtain another youth's medication.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrative Assistant was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 12/2/2024. Administrative Assistant reported over the
weekend Youth A followed Staff 1 into the medication closet and
reportedly took Lexapro and Clonidine which were another youth’s
medications. Youth A later told Shift Supervisor she took the
medications and gave Shift Supervisor the empty blister pack the
medications were in. Youth A was taken to the hospital and
assessed. Administrative Assistant reported the facility does not
have a policy indicating youth are not allowed to be in the
medication closet, staff are just told not to allow youth in the
medication closet.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
12/2/2024. Youth B reported she took medications that were
prescribed to another youth over the weekend. Youth B reported
she was mad and thought the medications would calm her down,
but the medications made her feel “weird and high”. Youth B
reported she “snuck in the medication closet and took them”.
Youth B explained Staff 1 was in the medication closet getting her
Midol and when Staff 1 turned his back she “took advantage” and
took the closest medications she could grab while Staff 1 was not
watching. Youth B reported Staff 1 told her to leave the
medication room twice however she did not listen. Youth B
reported since this incident, youth are no longer allowed in the
medication room.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 12/9/2024. Staff 1
reported Youth B requested Midol and he went to the room where
the medication closet is located. Staff 1 reported he unlocked the
room door however did not close the door to the room where the
medication closet is located as Youth B was not following him.
Once Staff 1 was inside the room and went to unlock the
medication closet door, Youth B came to the room door. Staff 1
asked Youth B to stay at the doorway to the room twice. Staff 1
reported he opened the medication closet door and Youth B
entered the room where the medication closet is located. Staff 1
told Youth B to not come any closer to the medication closet.
Staff 1 reported he is a newer staff and was looking in the
medication closet for the Midol. Youth B was standing outside the
medication closet door approximately six to seven feet away near
the desk. Staff 1 reported he asked Youth B to remain by the
desk. Staff 1 reported he located the Midol that was at the back of
4

the closet. Staff 1 turned his back to Youth B to get the Midol and
open the Midol. Staff 1 heard a cough and a loud noise that he
described as Youth B jumping or stomping as she moved into the
closet and Youth B coughed. Staff 1 reported he turned around
and Youth B had “lunged” into the closet. Staff 1 reported he
immediately told Youth B to leave the closet and walked her out.
Staff 1 reported he had his back turned to Youth B for
approximately two to three seconds and he was caught off guard
when Youth B “lunged” into the closet. Staff 1 reported he was
“naive” and did not think Youth B would do anything. Staff 1
reported Youth B was wearing an oversized hooded sweatshirt,
and he did not know Youth B had gotten any medications from the
closet. Staff 1 reported he later found out some of the youth’s
evening medications are kept in the side cubbies of the closet and
Youth B grabbed some. Staff 1 accepted responsibility and
reported he was trained not to allow youth into the room when the
medication closet door is open. Staff 1 reported he was trying to
go fast and did not follow what he was trained or has been told to
do.
Shift Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on 12/2/2024. Shift Supervisor reported she arrived to work on
11/29/2024 and Youth B came to her and informed her she had
taken another youth’s medications. Shift Supervisor asked Youth
B what she took, and Youth B gave her the empty blister pack the
medications were in. Youth B told Shift Supervisor she asked
Staff 1 to get her Midol and Staff 1 was getting the Midol and told
Youth B to stand back from the medication closet. Youth B told
Shift Supervisor when Staff 1 turned his back to get her Midol,
Youth B grabbed medication she could reach in the closet. Shift
Supervisor reported Staff 1 came to her and informed her he
turned his back to get her medication.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on
12/5/2024. Chief Administrator reported youth are allowed in the
room where the medication closet is located as the medication
closet has a sperate lock. Chief Administrator reported the only
time youth are not allowed in the room where the medication
closet is located is during medication pass time. During
medication pass time, the door that leads into the room is a full
door however can be closed fully or only the bottom have. During
medication pass time, the bottom half of the room door is closed
and locked and youth come to the door to take their medications.
Chief Administrator reported any time the medication closet door
is open, youth are not to be in the room.
5

Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity Investments Incident Report for Youth B
dated 11/29/2024: Youth B told Shift Supervisor she had
taken another youth’s medication and was sent to the
emergency room to be checked out as a precaution.
• Youth Opportunity New Hope Youth Center
Pharmaceuticals Policy: All medications (prescription, over
the counter, topical, etc.) shall be stored in a separate,
securely locked area that is inaccessible to youth. Only
those medical staff and custody staff who are trained in
medication delivery shall be permitted access to the clinic
area. Designated non-medical staff may administer
selected over-the-counter medicines to youth according to
protocols. Appropriate security of medications shall be
maintained during delivery/administration of medications.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 has no discipline in his
personnel file. Staff 1 received medication training during
orientation new hire training from 9/23/2024-10/3/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per interviews with staff
and youth, Youth B was able to obtain another youth’s medication
from the medication closet while Staff 1 was in the medication
closet getting the youth Midol. Youth B should not have been in
the medication room while the medication closet door was open
as the security of medications was not maintained during
delivery/administration of medications per the facilities policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Health services; policies and procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4142
Section (1) An institution shall establish and follow written health service
Description policies and procedures addressing all of the following:
(d) Storage of medications.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Medication closet was left unlocked.
Investigation Interviews:
Shift Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on 12/2/2024. Shift Supervisor reported after Youth B informed
her she took the medication, Shift Supervisor went into the room
where the medication closet is located, and the medication closet
door was not locked. Shift Supervisor reported there were youth in
the room and one youth picked up the medication closet lock and
6

handed it to her. Shift Supervisor reported there have been some
new staff and she believed it had been an oversight by a new
staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 12/9/2024. Staff 1
reported he believed he locked the medication closet door after he
walked Youth B out of the room. Staff 1 reported a little later he
went back into the medication closet to get Q-Tip’s and peroxide
for another youth, and he left the medication closet unlocked.
Staff 1 reported he left the medication closet unlocked as he was
going in and out of it. Staff 1 reported while he was in and out of
the medication closet an incident occurred at the house that he
went to assist with. Staff 1 reported he went back to the
medication closet two to three hours later and realized he had left
the medication closet door open and unlocked. Staff 1 reported
the room door leading to the medication closet was closed and
locked.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity New Hope Youth Center
Pharmaceuticals Policy: All medications (prescription, over
the counter, topical, etc.) shall be stored in a separate,
securely locked area that is inaccessible to youth.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 has no discipline in his
personnel file. Staff 1 received medication training during
orientation new hire training from 9/23/2024-10/3/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Shift Supervisor reported
finding the medication closet unlocked on 11/29/2024 and Staff 1
reported he did leave the medication closet unlocked.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2023C0000025 dated 12/13/2022, CAP Approved 1/6/2023
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
